page.title: 14FIDDLER'S FOLLY.MERCASTON
page.content: This is an unusual house because it is the only one in the area built of blue stone, which is found in Middleton-by- Wirksworth. There is a later addition of brick. There is theory that the house was originally a Public House hence the unusual name. Mr George Smith who lives here is a relief postman & small farmer. He has no grumbles about the local gypsies & has grown up with them. Dutch elm disease was very prevalent here. All the dead trees are cut down & replanting of oaks has taken place. There is mains water, electricity,& septic tank. Mr.Smith was born at Kingsgrove Farm nearby. The land is owned by Brailsford Estates.
